comment.text: This translation key is used to display a custom label for a single sign-on entry button. It appears in an IDP settings page and is used as a placeholder until a custom value is set. Translators should provide a clear and concise text that will be displayed on the UI.

usage.context:
<UploadXML />
 
 <SsoFormField
 labelText={t("CustomEntryButton")}
 name="spLoginLabel"
 placeholder={t("Settings:SingleSignOn")}
 tabIndex={4}
 tooltipContent={<Text fontSize="12px">{t("CustomEntryTooltip")}</Text>}
 tooltipClass="custom-entry-tooltip icon-button"
 value={spLoginLabel}
 hasError={spLoginLabelHasError}

{
 id: "portal-settings_catalog-sso",
 key: "4-2",
 icon: "",
 link: "sso",
 tKey: "SingleSignOn",
 isCategory: true,
 children: [
 {
 id: "portal-settings_catalog-sso-settings",
 key: "4-2-0",

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation "싱글 사인온" is a transliteration of "Single Sign-On" and doesn't convey the meaning naturally in Korean. A more appropriate translation would incorporate Korean terminology for 'single' and 'sign-on'.

While 'Logowanie jednokrotne' is a literal translation of 'Single Sign-On', it's not the most common or user-friendly term in Polish. 'Logowanie pojedyncze' or 'Logowanie przez SSO' would be better alternatives for clarity and alignment with common terminology.
The inclusion of '(SSO)' in parentheses is acceptable, but it might be better to use a more integrated approach or explanatory text for users unfamiliar with the acronym.

While 'Đăng nhập một lần' is a literal translation of 'Single Sign-On', it might not be the most common or easily understood term for users.  'SSO' is already included, which is good, but the full phrase is a bit clunky.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more established Vietnamese translation for 'Single Sign-On' if one exists.  Research common usage and industry standards.  Alternatively, keep 'SSO' and simplify the preceding phrase, perhaps just 'SSO' or 'Đăng nhập SSO'.
